Driving is a necessity for many Americans and car insurance is a requirement in most states. It's crucial for Congress to have the data needed to address discrimination and racial disparities in the car insurance marketplace to protect minority and low-income drivers.

In 2017, a report by the Federal Insurance Office found that nearly 20 million Americans, many living in predominantly minority and low-income communities, don't have access to affordable car insurance. Since then, the Trump Admin. has done nothing to address this discrepancy.

Numerous reports have found that people of color and low-income people are being overcharged for car insurance. These discriminatory practices and high rates are burdensome for people who need a car to get around every single day. https://www.propublica.org/article/minority-neighborhoods-higher-car-insurance-premiums-white-areas-same-riskÂ â€¦

I introduced the FAIR RATES Act to help combat discrimination in car insurance rates. It is unacceptable and unfair for minorities and low-income people to be charged more for their car insurance because of discriminatory reasons unrelated to risk. #FairRatesAct pic.twitter.com/u71HSOhVbF
